mathling

Class Mathling

  • java.lang.Object
    • mathling.Mathling
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Mathling
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Mathling is a personification of a wrapper for an Expression. Their purpose it to track the accuracy of an Expression in relation to some well-defined function they're trying to emulate. A "good Mathling" will therefore behave very closely to the function it approximates --- the closer the better.

    Mathlings' "aliveness" also helps to remind that these evolve while pure Expressions should remain immutable.

    The simulation itself is conducted in Main
    See Also:
    Expression, Main, Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Mathling()
      Creates a Mathling with a randomized Expression.
      Mathling(Expression e)
      Creates a Mathling with a predefined Expression.

      • collapse

        public double collapse(double input)
        A wrapper for the inner Expression's }collapse method.
        Parameters:
        input - The real number to pass to this Mathling's Expression.
        Returns:
        The result of the Expression's calculation.

      • calculateAccuracy

        public void calculateAccuracy(Computable f)
        Given a lambda, find the average difference between the Expression's approximation and the goal function's result.

        Note: Calculates the error across the range of minTest and maxTest.
        Parameters:
        f - The goal function to emulate.
        See Also:
        Expression.collapse(double), Computable

      • calculateAccuracyThunklet

        public void calculateAccuracyThunklet(Computable f)
        Identical to calculateAccuracy(Computable), except this first creates a Thunklet for the Expression before using it to then calculate the accuracy.
        Parameters:
        f - The goal function to emulate.
        See Also:
        Thunklet

      • getMutation

        public Mathling getMutation()
        Copies the inner Expression and returns a mutated form of it.
        Returns:
        A mutated form of this Mathling's Expression.
        See Also:
        MathlingMutator.mutateExpression(Expression, double, double[])

      • getExpression

        public Expression getExpression()
        Returns:
        The Mathling's Expression.

      • getAccuracy

        public double getAccuracy()
        Returns:
        The accuracy of this Mathling, which is the average difference between its Expression and the goal function.

      • setAccuracy

        public void setAccuracy(double newAccuracy)
        Forcefully alters this Mathling's accuracy.
        Parameters:
        newAccuracy - The accuracy to replace this one's.
